businessSummary.oneLiner: The world's largest EV maker pivoting into a 'Physical AI Platform' spanning robotaxis, humanoid robots, and energy storage.
businessSummary.description: Tesla is rapidly transforming from an EV manufacturer into an integrated AI, robotics, and energy platform company. FY2025 revenue was $94.8B, marking the first-ever annual revenue decline (-2.9%), with net income plunging 46.5%. However, on 2/17 the first Cybercab production unit rolled off Giga Texas, bringing the robotaxi era closer to reality. FSD cumulative miles surpassed 8.2 billion, and the Netherlands RDW granted FSD Supervised approval, opening European expansion. European sales declined for 13 consecutive months, and the $243M Autopilot verdict overturn attempt was rejected. Model S/X discontinuation confirmed for Q2 2026, with Fremont converting to Optimus robot production. On 2/24, Tesla website code revealed a 2026 Model 3 interior upgrade (black headliner, 16-inch QHD display).
howTheyMakeMoney: Vehicle sales: ~73% of revenue ($69.5B). Model 3/Y are core, Model S/X discontinued Q2 2026
Energy business: ~14% of revenue ($12.8B, +27% YoY). Megapack utility-scale storage. 46.7GWh deployed in 2025 (+48% YoY)
Services/Other: ~13% of revenue ($12.5B). Supercharger network, insurance, maintenance, parts
FSD subscription: $99/month autonomous driving software (subscription-only from Feb 2026)
keyProducts: Model 3/Y (core EVs, JD Power 2026 EV satisfaction #1 and #2)
Cybertruck (electric pickup, lower-priced AWD $59,990, Cyberbeast reduced to $99,990)
Cybercab (autonomous robotaxi, first production 2/17, $30,000, April mass production)
Optimus (humanoid robot, Fremont factory conversion underway, 1M/year long-term target)
Megapack (utility-scale energy storage, 46.7GWh in 2025, Megapack 3 coming)
FSD (Full Self-Driving, 8.2B miles cumulative, subscription-only, Netherlands EU approval)

keyMetrics.name: P/E (TTM)
keyMetrics.interpretation: Extremely high valuation. Stock price bets on future AI/robotaxi vision, not current earnings

keyMetrics.name: Forward P/E
keyMetrics.interpretation: Still over 200x on forward 12-month earnings. Maximum growth premium

keyMetrics.name: Market Cap
keyMetrics.interpretation: Largest in automotive history. Approaching combined value of all legacy automakers

keyMetrics.name: Revenue Growth (YoY)
keyMetrics.interpretation: First-ever annual revenue decline. Reflects intensifying competition and slowing sales

keyMetrics.name: Operating Margin
keyMetrics.interpretation: Significant decline from FY2024's 7.84%. Impact of price cuts and expanded R&D spending

keyMetrics.name: FCF
keyMetrics.interpretation: 73% improvement vs FY2024's $3.6B. Expanding capital allocation capacity

keyMetrics.name: ROE
keyMetrics.interpretation: Sharp decline from prior year. Reflects net income plunge

keyMetrics.name: Debt/Equity
keyMetrics.interpretation: Very low leverage. Net cash position maintained, strong financial health

growthDrivers.title: Cybercab Production Begins, Robotaxi Era Dawns
growthDrivers.description: On 2/17, the first steering-wheel-and-pedal-free Cybercab unit rolled off Giga Texas. Priced at $30,000, mass production starts April. Plans to expand robotaxi service to 9 US cities in H1.

growthDrivers.title: FSD 8.2B Miles + Subscription Pivot + First EU Approval
growthDrivers.description: FSD Supervised cumulative miles surpassed 8.2 billion. Transitioned to $99/month subscription-only model in February. Netherlands RDW granted first EU approval for FSD Supervised.

growthDrivers.title: Optimus Robot: Fremont Factory Conversion Underway
growthDrivers.description: Following Model S/X discontinuation (Q2 2026), Fremont lines converting to Optimus humanoid robot production. Gen 3 production started, 1,000+ units operating in-factory. Long-term target: 1M units/year.

growthDrivers.title: 2026 Model 3 Interior Upgrade + Cybertruck Lineup Expansion
growthDrivers.description: On 2/24, website code revealed black headliner and 16-inch QHD display for Model 3. Cybertruck AWD $59,990 launched, Cyberbeast reduced to $99,990 to stimulate demand.

competitiveAdvantage.summary: US EV market share 50%+ (#1), though overtaken globally by BYD. Software-manufacturing-energy vertical integration and 8.2B autonomous driving miles form the core moat.

moats.description: FSD Supervised 8.2B miles (including 3B urban miles). Overwhelmingly larger training dataset vs competitors.
In-house batteries (4680), custom chips (HW4), software (FSD), charging infrastructure (Supercharger). Expanding into robotics and energy.
NACS adopted as North American EV charging standard. GM, Ford, Rivian depend on Tesla's Supercharger network.

competitors.name: BYD
competitors.detail: 2025 global EV sales #1 (2.26M units, +28%). 35% China market share. US entry restricted by tariffs

competitors.name: Waymo (Alphabet)
competitors.detail: $16B funding, $126B valuation. 400K+ weekly rides, 127M autonomous miles

competitors.name: Rivian (RIVN)
competitors.detail: R2 SUV ($45,000) launching 2026, direct competition with Model Y

competitors.name: GM
competitors.detail: US EV share ~13%, growing rapidly. Diverse model lineup on Ultium platform

recentNews.headline: Tesla Website Code Reveals 2026 Model 3 Interior Upgrade ‚Äî Black Headliner, 16-inch QHD Display
recentNews.significance: Signal of Model 3 product competitiveness enhancement. Premium interior upgrade in Model Y style.

recentNews.headline: Tesla European Registrations Down 17% YoY in January, 13th Consecutive Monthly Decline
recentNews.significance: Continued market share erosion in Europe. Musk political controversy and competition compounding.

recentNews.headline: $243M Autopilot Verdict Overturn Attempt Rejected
recentNews.significance: Autopilot-related legal risk persists. Potential for additional lawsuits.

recentNews.headline: Cybertruck AWD $59,990 Launched, Cyberbeast Reduced $15,000 to $99,990
recentNews.significance: Pricing strategy addressing Cybertruck demand weakness. Market share defense amid intensifying competition.

recentNews.headline: Tesla Sues California DMV to Remove FSD 'False Advertising' Label
recentNews.significance: FSD regulatory risk alongside acceleration of autonomous driving trust debate.

analystOpinions.notableComment: Tigress Financial upgraded Hold to Strong Buy with $550 target (2/12). GLJ Research maintains $25 Strong Sell. Extreme analyst opinion divergence.

risks.title: European Sales Down 13 Consecutive Months, Intensifying Global Competition
risks.description: European January registrations -17% YoY. BYD/Chinese EV makers' global offensive combined with Musk political controversy. Non-US market share decline continues.

risks.title: Extreme Valuation at P/E 384x
risks.description: FY2025 EPS $1.08 at 384x P/E. Sharp valuation correction inevitable if robotaxi/Optimus vision fails to materialize.

risks.title: Autopilot/FSD Legal and Regulatory Risk
risks.description: $243M verdict overturn rejected, California DMV 'false advertising' dispute. Potential for stricter FSD safety regulations.

risks.title: Revenue Decline and Margin Compression
risks.description: FY2025 revenue -2.9%, operating margin down to 4.59%. Price competition pressure and $20B+ CapEx investment burden.

risks.title: Elon Musk DOGE Activities ‚Äî Brand Risk
risks.description: Musk's DOGE government efficiency activities accelerating European and liberal consumer defection.

buyReasons.title: Cybercab Mass Production ‚Äî Approaching $10T+ Robotaxi TAM
buyReasons.rationale: April mass production, H1 expansion to 9 US cities. Success triggers re-rating from automaker to platform company valuation.

buyReasons.title: FSD 8.2B Mile Data Moat + EU Approval
buyReasons.rationale: Netherlands first EU approval opens European FSD expansion. Subscription model transition creates high-margin recurring revenue.

buyReasons.title: Energy Business Sustained High Growth
buyReasons.rationale: 2025 energy storage 46.7GWh (+48% YoY). Megapack 3 launch provides additional growth runway.

buyReasons.title: Optimus Long-Term Option Value
buyReasons.rationale: Fremont factory conversion underway. Success potential to make Tesla a $10T+ company.

overallOpinion: Tesla is at peak 'vision vs reality' divergence. Growth catalysts like Cybercab's first production and FSD EU approval are materializing, but FY2025 revenue decline, 13 consecutive months of European sales drops, and 384x P/E coexist.

Short-term, positioned in a neutral zone below the 50-day SMA ($439) and above the 200-day SMA ($389). RSI 43.55 approaching oversold. Cybertruck price cuts and Model 3 upgrades may help form a demand floor.

Consensus target $396 implies -4.5% downside. However, bull case ($550-600) assumes robotaxi/Optimus success. Suitable for long-term investors who can tolerate high volatility; risky for short-term trading.

sources.name: StockAnalysis
sources.description: TSLA valuation, financial metrics, price statistics

sources.name: Financhill
sources.description: Technical indicators ‚Äî SMA, RSI, Bollinger Bands

sources.name: Invezz
sources.description: Tesla stock decline analysis ‚Äî autonomous competition, EV demand slowdown
